customer_name: Elizabeth Yutzy Marianna Yutzy Jonas Yutzy
site_name: Elizabeth Yutzy Marianna Yutzy Jonas Yutzy

citations.narrative:
There was no medical record created for a sick puppy (22-25, DOB 5/24/2025). It had been treated with an antibiotic sub-
cutaneously and fluids by mouth. A veterinarian had been contacted but there was no record of instructions given.
Medical records are important to document any illness or injury and that appropriate care was given.
Dealers must keep medical records for dogs documenting all required information including the date and identification of
animals treated, and if a problem is identified (such as a disease, injury, or illness), the date and a description of the
problem, examination findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed, when
appropriate; fully detailed treatment plans, and results of examinations conducted by licensed veterinarians. The licensee
must ensure medical records are created and maintained and fully document all procedures, treatments, and
examinations for each adult dog and puppy.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Marla Renshaw, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.13(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There was no medical record created for a sick puppy (22-25, DOB 5/24/2025). It had been treated with an antibiotic sub-
cutaneously and fluids by mouth. A veterinarian had been contacted but there was no record of instructions given. 
Medical records are important to document any illness or injury and that appropriate care was given.  
Dealers must keep medical records for dogs documenting all required information including the date and identification of 
animals treated, and if a problem is identified (such as a disease, injury, or illness), the date and a description of the 
problem, examination findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed, when 
appropriate; fully detailed treatment plans, and results of examinations conducted by licensed veterinarians. The licensee

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
